|brand = Linksys |model = WRP400 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 01/20/2011 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/Linksys_WRP400_v1.0 |wlclass = G54 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = wireless router, analog phone gateway |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = Q87-WRP400 |icid = 3839A-WRP400 |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = 3763-14141406R |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Marvell;88W8518; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = ARM926 |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 360 <!-- 360 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Spansion;S29GL064A90TFIR3; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = Mira;P2V28S40CTP-G6; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Marvell;88E6061; |voip_ports = 2 |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = <!-- 10MbE,100MbE,1GbE, --> |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |oui = <!-- Wireless OUI -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_sim_num = <!-- Number of sim Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_pcmcia_num = <!-- Number of pcmcia ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_expcard_num = <!-- Number of Expresscard ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipci_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCI Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_minipcie_num = <!-- Number of Mini PCIexpress Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_usb_num = 1 |exp_cf_num = <!-- Number Compact Flash Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sdmmc_num = <!-- Number SD/MMC Slots, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ide_num = <!-- Number of ide ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_ata_num = <!-- Number of ATA Ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sata_num = <!-- Number of sata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_esata_num = <!-- Number of esata ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_parallel = <!-- Number of parallel ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_sfp_num = <!-- Number of sfp ports, Leave blank for none --> |exp_M.2 = <!-- Number of M.2 ports, Leave blank for none --> |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bg
|defaulip = 192.168.15.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 07/05/2007 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 745883580958 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B000YQLCGG |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = <!-- Country device was manufactured in -->
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Marvell;88W8518; |rad1chip2 = Marvell;88W8010; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Per the FCC docs... *Initial Filing (07/05/2007) **"3763-14141406R" is silkscreened on the board. **There is no USB port pictured on the board.. but there are solder pads for one. *C2PC made 01/23/2009 **"3763-14141403R" is silkscreened on the board. **The change notice notes that the USB port was added through a class I change. **The change noted additional USB 3.5G (CDMA) sticks will be tested with the device. ***'''Sprint''' - '''Novatel Wireless''' Ovation U727 - FCC ID: PKRNVWMC727 ***'''Sprint''' - '''Novatel Wireless''' Ovation U720 - FCC ID: PKRNVWMCD3000 ***'''Sierra Wireless''' AirCard 595U - FCC ID: N7N-MC5725U *C2PC made 07/14/2009 **"3763-14141406R" is silkscreened on the board. **The WLAN PA was changed from a '''Fairchild Semiconductor''' RMPA2455 to a '''Richwave''' RTC6691E.
==Links of Interest== [http://wiki.openwrt.org/oldwiki/OpenWrtDocs/Hardware/Linksys/WRP400 On the OpenWrt wiki] :The CPU is stated as a 88W8518 in the boot log. This is presumed to be correct. [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=15588 '''''Linksys locking down serial bootloader console to prevent hacking''''' on the '''OpenWrt Forums''']
[http://www.nslu2-linux.org/wiki/WRP400/HomePage WRP400 on the NSLU2-Linux wiki] :[http://www.nslu2-linux.org/wiki/WRP400/PhotosOfTheInternals Internal photos]
*[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=364079 Wrp 400] On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum *[http://www.telephonydepot.com/Catalog/Switches/Linksys-WRP400-Wireless-G-Broadband-Router Linksys-WRP400-Wireless-G-Broadband-Router]
